page.title: 11Farming
page.content: {Farming}has been one of the chief industries in the area since early times.There are tenant farms,private ownership farms and Bridgets the Experimental farm. The five tenant farmers rent their land from the Hampshire County Council the average size of each farm being approximately 100 acres (40 hectares).The farms are mainly dairy farms with Friesian herds and heifers to restock.The cows are milked in herring bone parlours,the milk collected in bulk carriers each day.Some farms have a sheep stock and sell free range hens eggs. Bridgets Farm at Martyr Worthy was Budgets Farm, it is an experimental {Husbandry}farm taken over by the Ministry of Agriculture in 1948. Grace's Farm is both arable and a dairy farm and Meadow Farm is dairy.
